##### Assignment 2

###### Quick look
```{r, quick look, echo=TRUE}
# Load data
data("anscombe")
# Dimensions
dim(anscombe)
# Column names
names(anscombe)
# First and last 6 lines of data
head(anscombe, n=6)
tail(anscombe, n=6)
# Summary statistics
summary(anscombe)
```

##### Assignment 3

###### XY Plot
```{r xy_plot, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center', fig.width=8, fig.height=8, dev='svg', fig.path='./figures/'}
data("anscombe")
# Scatterplot
plot(anscombe$x1, anscombe$y1)
# Add abline showing linear regression
abline(lm(y1 ~ x1, data = anscombe))
```

##### Assignment 4

###### Importing data
```{r data_import, echo=TRUE}
#Use readr package to read data from url and store dataframe into object called 'df'.
df <- read.csv('https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/11805474/painblogr/biostats/assignments/analgesic.csv')
```

###### Summarising a dataset
```{r data_summary, echo=TRUE}
# Dimensions 
dim(df)
# Names of columns
names(df)
# First and last 6 lines of data
head(df, n=6)
tail(df, n=6)
# Summary statistics
summary(df)
```

###### Tidying data
```{r data_tidy, echo=TRUE}
# Load packages
library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
# Tidy data from wide to long format
gathered <- gather(df, key = Measurement, value = Value, Measurement_1:Measurement_3)
# Summarize data by calculating mean across the measurements for each individual
summary <- summarise(group_by(gathered, ID), mean(Value))
# Print final data frame
print(summary)
# Table shows mean (mean(Value)) of three measurements for each subject (ID)
```
